block.p: Prosecutor in Duke Case Disbarred by Ethics Panel Michael B. Nifong, the North Carolina prosecutor who brought assault charges against three Duke lacrosse players, was disbarred after volunteering to give up his license. In the last year, Mr. Nifong's handling of the case has come under severe criticism, and all charges against the men have been dropped. ''There is no discipline short of disbarment that would be appropriate in this case,'' an ethics panel said.
PAGE 21
Suicide Bombing in Kabul A suicide bomb in the Afghan capital near an American convoy killed the bomber and four others. Later, U.S. soldiers fired into a crowd of Afghans nearby, killing a man.
PAGE 10

Housing Charity Is Accused Residents of a Florida development built by Habitat for Humanity seven years ago say that their low-cost houses are crumbling and infested with insects and rodents, and that the charity has been aloof and unresponsive.
PAGE 14
Jeter Lifts the Yankees Derek Jeter hit a two-run homer that put the Yankees ahead for good in their 11-8 victory over the Mets at Yankee Stadium.
SPORTSSUNDAY

An East German Symbol Turns 50, Rust-Free (It's Plastic) A proud Trabant owner flying the East German flag was among 2,000 who gathered in Zwickau, Germany, to celebrate 50 years of the rattletrap cars, symbols of nostalgia for a time before the Berlin Wall fell.
PAGE 3
Alaska's Lost Bearings The frontier state is looking for its next big boom, but scandal and waning clout in Washington have put its future in doubt.
WEEK IN REVIEW
Beware the Leprosy Card Nicole Holmes had leprosy. Now immigration demagogues loom. Editorial Observer.
OPINION PAGES

Prosecutor in Duke Case Disbarred by Ethics Panel Michael B. Nifong, the North Carolina prosecutor who brought assault charges against three Duke lacrosse players, was disbarred after volunteering to give up his license. In the last year, Mr. Nifong's handling of the case has come under severe criticism, and all charges against the men have been dropped. ''There is no discipline short of disbarment that would be appropriate in this case,'' an ethics panel said.
